title: Levi Ottman
text: My name is Levi Ottman. I am a 19-year-old passionate about Creative Media, as well as anything related to sports. I am currently in my second year at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, studying Sports Media & Communications, with a minor in Art-Photography. I graduate in the Spring of 2026. My goal after I graduate is to work in professional or collegiate sports working in creative media. I currently work for the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, Athletic Department as a Creative Media intern, covering Basketball, Rifle, Soccer, and Softball. Since I was a kid, I have always had a passion for sports. I love capturing and telling stories from a unique perspective to share with others.

title: From Rookies to Rings: How the Golden State Warriors Develop Young Talent
text:
Are the Warriors the best at drafting rookies recently? The Warriors have won four championships since 2015, cementing themselves as a modern-day dynasty, with that comes low draft pick numbers. In the last 10 drafts, the warriors have had an average first round pick at pick 19, but have been able to develop late-round rookies into key players that have contributed to their continued success. I am comparing the warriors picks to other players drafted just behind them to see if they truly drafted the best guy available at the time

Kuminga_Stat_Chart_long <- Kuminga_Stat_Chart |>
   select(Player, PTSper36, TRBper36, ASTper36) |>
  pivot_longer(cols = c(PTSper36, TRBper36, ASTper36), names_to = "Stat", values_to = "Value") |>
  mutate(
    Stat = factor(Stat, levels = c("PTSper36", "TRBper36", "ASTper36")),
    Stat = recode(Stat, 
                  "PTSper36" = "Points Per 36 Minutes", 
                  "TRBper36" = "Total Rebounds Per 36 Minutes", 
                  "ASTper36" = "Assists Per 36 Minutes"),
    Color = case_when(
      Player == "Jonathan Kuminga" & Stat == "Points Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#1D428A",
      Player == "Jonathan Kuminga" & Stat == "Total Rebounds Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#1D428A",
      Player == "Jonathan Kuminga" & Stat == "Assists Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#1D428A", 
      Player == "James Bouknight" & Stat == "Points Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#1D1160",
      Player == "James Bouknight" & Stat == "Total Rebounds Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#1D1160",
      Player == "James Bouknight" & Stat == "Assists Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#1D1160", 
      Player == "Ziaire Williams" & Stat == "Points Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#C6CFD4",
      Player == "Ziaire Williams" & Stat == "Total Rebounds Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#C6CFD4",
      Player == "Ziaire Williams" & Stat == "Assists Per 36 Minutes" ~ "#C6CFD4",
      TRUE ~ "grey"  # Default color for other players
    )
  )

ggplot(Kuminga_Stat_Chart_long, aes(x = Player, y = Value, fill = Color)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  labs(
    title = str_wrap("Do the Warriors have a budding superstar in Jonathan Kuminga? Only time will tell for the fourth-year Forward drafted 7th overall in the 2021 NBA Draft", width = 63),
    subtitle = str_wrap("A comparison of Jonathan Kuminga's career stats the next drafted player at his position in the NBA 2021 Draft, adjusted using 'Per 36' minutes stats.", width = 90),
    x = "Player", 
    y = "Per Game",
    caption = "Source: Data from Basketball-Reference.com"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_fill_identity() +
  facet_wrap(~ Stat, scales = "free_y")
